business.headline: Gold, silver hit fresh highs: Will safe-haven demand keep driving gains?There is no stopping gold and silver. The two precious metals are on a roll, and experts say the rally may continue in the near term as global uncertainty keeps safe-haven demand elevated.

ITR refund delayed? Here's why it's stuck, how to check the status and whom to contactAn income tax refund delay can be frustrating, especially when everything seems in order. From data mismatches to bank account issues, even small errors can stop the refund from reaching your account on time.

Tariffs, tension and turbulence: Is it time to hit refresh on your stock investments?Global volatility may stay elevated, but investors can still stay on track by strengthening portfolios, adding quality stocks on dips, and avoiding emotional reactions. Resilience, not prediction, is the strategy that endures.

Chinese labour is no longer cheap. So how is it still world's manufacturing hub?Manufacturing labour costs in China have risen sharply over the past three decades. By around 2022, Chinese factory wages were close to $8 per hour. In comparison, wages stood at about $2.3 per hour in Vietnam, $2.1 in Malaysia, $1.9 in Thailand and just $1.1 in India.

Sensex, Nifty open lower over weak global cues; IT and financials drag marketThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 269.93 points to 82,976.25, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 69.25 points to 25,516.25 as of 9:30 am.

Shadowfax IPO opens for bidding: Should you subscribe? Check latest GMPShadowfax Technologies IPO is a book-built issue worth Rs 1,907.27 crores. The issue includes a fresh issue of 8.06 crore shares amounting to Rs 1,000.00 crores. It also has an offer for sale of 7.32 crore shares worth Rs 907.27 crores.

Not America, but Trump is definitely making gold great againUS President Donald Trump isn't making America great again, but he is unquestionably making gold greater than ever. As uncertainty deepens, the world's confidence is shifting from Washington to bullion.

India to be upper-middle income by 2030, third largest economy by 2028: SBIIndia is projected to become an upper-middle income country by 2030 and the third-largest economy by 2028. This economic transition reflects sustained growth and reform efforts but also poses challenges to maintain momentum.

India contributing to 20% of overall global growth: WEF chief Borge BrendeIn an exclusive interview with India Today, World Economic Forum President Borge Brende hailed India as the fastest growing of the large economies in the world, contributing to 20% of the overall global growth.

India ranks above US, China in new Responsible Nations IndexThe United States has been placed at 66th, while China ranks 68th in the Responsible Nations Index 2026. Russia has been ranked much lower at 96th, reflecting weaker scores across responsibility parameters.

India on track to achieve 500 GW renewable energy target by 2030: Pralhad JoshiJoshi said investor interest in India's renewable sector has been strong, with over $145 billion invested in the past 10 years, including $20 billion in foreign direct investment.
HCLTech CEO explains how AI is reshaping IT jobs and revenuesVijayakumar said the global business environment has been turbulent over the past few years, but things now appear to be stabilising.

Børge Brende to India Today: 'The Ukraine war possibly could end this year' after four yearsWorld Economic Forum President Børge Brende joins India Today's Rajdeep Sardesai at Davos to discuss the most complex geopolitical landscape since 1945. Brende highlights that despite global tensions, including potential friction between Europe and the US over Greenland, global growth remains resilient at over 3%. He notes that 'the Ukraine war possibly could end this year' if there is sufficient willingness for a solution. The discussion covers India's rising economic influence, with Brende describing India as a 'US$10 trillion economy pretty soon' that contributes 20% to global growth. He addresses the 'Trumpian world order,' suggesting that while media focuses on the 'noise,' quiet bilateral cooperation continues to drive the global agenda. Brende identifies escalating conflict in the Gulf, debt bubbles, and 'black swan' events like cyber warfare as the primary risks to global stability in 2026. He emphasizes that the WEF remains an impartial platform where competing powers like the US, China, and India can engage in essential dialogue.
IMF Hikes India's GDP Growth Estimate to 7.3% for 2025-26The International Monetary Fund (IMF) has revised India's GDP growth estimate for the financial year 2025-26 upward to 7.3 percent.

RBI proposes linking BRICS digital currencies to ease cross-border trade: ReportIf accepted, it would mark the first formal attempt to link the central bank digital currencies (CBDCs) of BRICS members, a move that could reduce dependence on the US dollar at a time of heightened geopolitical tensions.

Global trade moving towards mini-lateral and plurilateral deals, says WEF's Kimberley BotwrightGlobal trade is entering a new phase, with countries moving away from broad multilateral agreements and increasingly turning to smaller, targeted trade deals, says Kimberley Botwright.

Sensex tanks over 300 points, Nifty tumbles amid global uncertaintyThe Sensex fell more than 300 points, while the Nifty slipped below the crucial 25,600 mark as investors remained cautious through the session.

India can strike trade deals on its own terms, says WEF chief Borge BrendeBorge Brende said that India's rise over the past few years has reshaped its leverage in the global economy, giving New Delhi far more room to decide when and with whom it wants to sign trade deals.

IMF lifts India's FY26 growth forecast to 7.3% amid global uncertaintyIn its latest World Economic Outlook report, the IMF said India's economy is now expected to grow by 7.3% in FY26, up 0.7 percentage points from its earlier estimate. The upgrade reflects better-than-expected growth in the third quarter and continued strength in the fourth quarter of the current fiscal year.

Can Budget 2026 deliver scale, skills and digital growth for manufacturing?Budget 2026 is expected to play a key role in shaping the future of India's manufacturing sector. From expanding scale to building skilled manpower and driving digital adoption, the industry has clear expectations from the government.

entertainment.headline: Border 2 advance booking targets mega opening for Sunny Deol, eyes War 2, Gadar 2 Border 2 has begun advance bookings with promising sales. The film is set to premiere during the Republic Day 2026 weekend and is positioned for a strong box office opening.

Cast a Muslim star, but make him Hindu: Honey Trehan on film being shelved Filmmaker Honey Trehan has spoken about a film project that was abandoned after he was told the main character must be Hindu even if a Muslim superstar was cast.

Easy to trash someone: Suniel Shetty defends Varun Dhawan amid Border 2 backlash Suniel Shetty came out in support of Varun Dhawan after he faced trolling over the release of Border 2 song 'Ghar Kab Aaoge'.

Divya Agarwal likens The 50 to Squid Game: There are no shortcuts Divya Agarwal shared her thoughts as she joins the upcoming reality show The 50. She highlighted the unpredictability of the format and her preparation for the challenge in a recent interview. The show premieres on February 1.

Atlee, wife Priya announce second pregnancy: Our home is about to get even cozier Filmmaker Atlee and wife Priya Atlee announced that they are expecting their second child following the birth of their son Meer in January 2023.

Kunal Kapoor exposes western media bias, says narratives are manufactured globally Actor Kunal Kapoor reflected on media bias, questioning the idea that Western outlets are neutral or objective. He recalled a personal encounter that exposed how narratives are shaped by powerful interests worldwide.

O' Romeo trailer launch in Mumbai amid legal and security concerns. Check date Following speculation about security issues, the trailer launch of O' Romeo starring Shahid Kapoor will take place in January, in Mumbai, as the filmmakers address concerns raised by gangster Hussain Ustara's family regarding the portrayal of his life.

Ravi Kishan pushes for TV category at National Awards, plans to write to ministry Actor-politician Ravi Kishan has voiced his support for the inclusion of television in the National Awards. He also shared his intention to propose the idea formally to the ministry.

Dhurandhar on OTT: When and where to watch Ranveer Singh's biggest blockbuster Ranveer Singh's action film Dhurandhar will begin streaming on OTT soon. The makers have reportedly bagged one of the best streaming deals ever in the history of Hindi cinema.

Kohrra Season 2: Barun Sobti's Garundi moves to a new city; release date announced Netflix's Kohrra returns with its second season on February 11 featuring a darker, emotionally rich narrative. The season explores a new investigation led by Barun Sobti and Mona Singh amid Punjab's stark winter backdrop.

Farah Khan confirms directorial return, plans new film with Shah Rukh Khan After years away from filmmaking, Farah Khan confirmed that she will direct a new film and suggested Shah Rukh Khan would be involved.

Here's what Rashmika Mandanna said on wedding rumours with Vijay Deverakonda Rashmika Mandanna has addressed ongoing rumours about her wedding with Vijay Deverakonda. stating she will speak about the matter when the time is right, amidst widespread speculation about an upcoming private ceremony in Udaipur.

Vinay Anand reacts to Govinda's affair rumours, prays his marriage remains strong Vinay Anand responded to speculation around Govinda and Sunita Ahuja's marriage, urging privacy and expressing hope for their relationship, while also addressing family remarks and the ongoing online debates.

Rajinikanth, Nelson Dilipkumar arrive in Kochi for Jailer 2 shoot. Viral videos Superstar Rajinikanth and director Nelson Dilipkumar have arrived in Kochi to resume shooting for Jailer 2. The film's final schedule aims to wrap up by mid-February ahead of its anticipated June release.

The brilliance of writing a stupid movie ft. Happy Patel: Khatarnak Jasoos From quirky jokes to heartwarming moments, Happy Patel shows how stupidity can be genius if written the right way. A rare win for Bollywood in absurd comedy.

Amruta Khanvilkar felt empowered doing stunts in Taskaree: I was one of the boys In an exclusive interview with India Today, Amruta Khanvilkar shared her experience of performing action sequences in the latest Netflix series 'Taskaree.' The actor said how it was something she always wished for.

Vijay's Jana Nayagan hits 1 million interests on BookMyShow ahead of court hearing Vijay's final film Jana Nayagan has surpassed one million expressions of interest on BookMyShow while audiences await its release. The film was delayed due to an ongoing legal dispute over Central Board of Film Certification clearance.

Don't drag my innocent husband: Neha Kakkar addresses divorce rumours amid break Singer Neha Kakkar has addressed speculation about her marriage to Rohanpreet Singh, following social media posts about taking a break from responsibilities, relationships, and work. Kakkar requested privacy and urged people not to involve her family in public discussions.

Palaash Muchhal begins work on new film after cancelled wedding with Smriti Mandhana Composer and filmmaker Palasah Muchhal is set to work on a new film months after his wedding with Indian cricketer Smriti Mandhana was cancelled amid personal controversy. Muchhal has signed his next film project, which is expected to be announced soon.

general news.headline: Nitin Nabin my boss, I am a worker: PM Modi welcomes new, 'millennial' BJP chiefPrime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday welcomed Nitin Nabin as the new and "millennial" president of the BJP during a grand ceremony at the party headquarters in Delhi.

Live: Will Jana Nayagan clear Censor hurdle? Madras High Court hearing beginsJana Nayagan Hearing Live Updates: Thalapathy Vijay's Jana Nayagan was supposed to hit theatres on January 9, but was postponed after CBFC withheld the censor certificate. The Madras High Court will resume hearing in Jana Nayagan vs CBFC case today.

Nobody wants him: Trump vows 200% wine tariffs after Macron's Peace Board snubThe Board of Peace initiative was first announced by Trump in September 2025 as part of a strategy to resolve the conflict in Gaza. Since then, the administration has expanded the initiative's scope, inviting world leaders, including Prime Minister Narendra Modi, to join efforts to address a range of global conflicts.

Virat and Rohit likely to be demoted, BCCI may scrap top contract bracketThe Ajit Agarkar-led selection committee has suggested removing the top bracket, the A-plus category, from the annual retainership contracts. As a result, Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli are likely to be demoted to the B category, having featured in only one format of international cricket since January 2025.

Trump chickening out from military action in Greenland?Trump has become fixated on acquiring Greenland, the semi-autonomous territory of Nato ally Denmark. He has also dangled the military sword since the new year started. However, Trump seems to be now looking for an off-ramp from the standoff.

Governor Ravi walks out of assembly, says national anthem insulted, Stalin reactsTamil Nadu Governor RN Ravi walked out of the assembly session on Tuesday after alleging the national anthem was insulted, and refusing to deliver a state government-prepared speech that he claimed carried "inaccuracies".

Better burn the house now: France goes all out, openly mocks US over GreenlandFrance has now openly mocked its ally, the US, over Donald Trump's ambition to seize Greenland, under the control of Denmark, as tension between Washington and the European Union escalates.

Yes, I killed my wife, but it wasn't murder: Indian-origin man to Australian courtAn Indian-origin man, Vikrant Thakur, has formally taken responsibility for his wife's killing but told the court that he is not guilty of her murder. The investigation into the case began in late December when Supriya Thakur was found unconscious at her home by police officers.

India's trash sleeper cells now target Vande BharatWithin hours of its inauguration on Saturday, the Vande Bharat Sleeper express was strewn with plastic and spoons, as if civic sense had taken an early holiday. Though India is trying to upgrade to shiny Vande Bharat trains, old mail train habits seem difficult to shed for Indians. Here's why.

Nitin Nabin takes charge as BJP president, youngest to lead partyThe 45-year-old is an undefeated five-time MLA from the Bankipur seat in Bihar. He is the son of late BJP leader and former MLA Nabin Kishore Prasad Sinha.

DGP-rank Karnataka cop Ramachandra Rao suspended over viral  sleaze videoThe Karnataka government suspended senior cop Ramachandra Rao after a video surfaced on social media showing his alleged intimate moments in his official chamber.

Mum danced very inappropriately on me: Son Brooklyn's damning post on BeckhamsBrooklyn Beckham has issued a detailed statement claiming that his parents, David and Victoria Beckham, attempted to control his life and harmed his relationship with his wife, Nicola Peltz.

Why don't you have kids? This question needs to stopIn today's time, when being child-free is a common reality rather than an exception, questioning someone about why they don't have kids is intrusive, hypocritical, deeply triggering, and simply insensitive.

India ranks above US, China in new Responsible Nations IndexThe United States has been placed at 66th, while China ranks 68th in the Responsible Nations Index 2026. Russia has been ranked much lower at 96th, reflecting weaker scores across responsibility parameters.

Airline CEO calls Elon Musk an idiot, Musk threatens to buy his company and fire himA brief outage on Elon Musk-owned X spiralled into a viral war of words after Ryanair's boss called Musk an "idiot," prompting the billionaire to joke about buying the airline and firing him.

Indians lose crores in digital arrest scams. Who's running them?The arrest of Chen Zhi, the alleged kingpin of a global cyber scam network, puts the focus back on the Golden Triangle. Open-source data and satellite images reveal an expansive network of scam centres operating across Myanmar, Cambodia, Laos and Thailand.

End of an Era: What Valentino really meant to fashionIconic women like Elizabeth Taylor, Julia Roberts, Jacqueline Kennedy, Princess Diana, Grace Kelly, Oprah Winfrey, Anne Hathaway, Jennifer Aniston, Zendaya, and Margot Robbie have famously worn Valentino Garavani's timeless designs.

Why Uttarakhand's hills are without snow for the first time in 40 yearsThe lack of snow still raises alarms and renews the focus on the effects of climate change being felt across habitats and regions in India.

Trump fumes over EU troops in Greenland, later admits intel was wrong: ReportDonald Trump's admission reportedly came during a phone call with British Prime Minister Keir Starmer on Sunday, in which the latter criticised the US President's decision to impose new tariffs on European countries, including the UK, for their support of Greenland.

Biker escapes deadly accident as Chinese manjha wraps around neck, records vlogShahabuddin Ansari shared a video showing the aftermath of the incident, in which a manjha got wrapped around his neck while he was riding his bike.

Is 40 the new layoff age in corporate India's job market?By 40, experience should be your greatest strength, yet in corporate India, it is increasingly becoming a hidden liability. As companies chase youth, speed, and lower costs, mid-career professionals are being pushed aside without explanation.

India's top pole-vaulter thrown off train by TTE, viral video sparks controversyNational record holder Dev Meena and fellow athlete Kuldeep Yadav were told to deboard the train at Panvel station. Their mistake? Carry the essential gear of their sport – the pole, while returning from a competition.

Time, Tide & Tamil Part 15 | Bhakti: Tamilakam's Epic Counter and Gift to BharatThe Tamil landscape, for centuries, had been shaped by the self-denying, often severe, philosophies of Jainism and Buddhism.

The brilliance of writing a stupid movie ft. Happy Patel: Khatarnak JasoosFrom quirky jokes to heartwarming moments, Happy Patel shows how stupidity can be genius if written the right way. A rare win for Bollywood in absurd comedy.

sports.headline: Clarke to stay with NZ squad for three T20Is as injury cover for Bracewell New Zealand pacer Kristian Clarke will remain with the squad as injury cover for Michael Bracewell during the five-match T20I series against India. Bracewell's participation, meanwhile, will depend on his recovery from a minor left-calf strain sustained during the third ODI in Indore.

Virat and Rohit likely to be demoted, BCCI may scrap top contract bracket The Ajit Agarkar-led selection committee has suggested removing the top bracket, the A-plus category, from the annual retainership contracts. As a result, Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli are likely to be demoted to the B category, having featured in only one format of international cricket since January 2025.

Hardik Pandya surprises RCB's Gautami Nayak following her maiden WPL fifty Hardik Pandya surprised Gautami Naik with a congratulatory message after her maiden fifty in WPL 2026. Naik notched up a brilliant half-century against Gujarat Giants (GG), scoring 73 off 55 balls with the help of seven fours and six sixes in her innings.

Ricky Ponting's love for The Undertaker: How a WWE poster chokeslammed his bad luck Ricky Ponting's passion for wrestling great, The Undertaker, sparked a unique superstition during his cricket career. This quirky ritual coincided with his prolific run-scoring, revealed his former teammate Jason Gillespie.

Quiet bat, loud rumours: Why Rohit Sharma can't afford another poor ODI series Star India batter Rohit Sharma finds himself at a crucial juncture in his career, following his poor show in the New Zealand series. As he turns 39 this year, the margin of error would be nil for the India star with Yashasvi Jaiswal eagerly waiting for his opportunity on the bench.

Has Alcaraz copied Djokovic's serve? Serbian great jokes about copyright claim Australian Open 2026: Novak Djokovic joked about Carlos Alcaraz's serve motion being similar to his own. The Serb spoke about the similarities in their serves after his dominant first-round win at Melbourne Park.

Zadran, Rasooli star as Afghanistan stun West Indies ahead of T20 World Cup Afghanistan gave West Indies a reality check with a 38-run win in the first T20I in Dubai ahead of the T20 World Cup 2026. West Indies were restricted to 143/9 in their 20 overs, chasing a target of 182.

After India Open chaos, Sports Minister pushes SAI to save Olympic dreams Sports Minister Mansukh Mandaviya held a meeting with the officials of the Sports Authority of India (SAI) to discuss the venue lapses during the India Open Badminton tournament.

Shreyas Iyer's T20 comeback: Can he force his way into World Cup team? India vs New Zealand: Shreyas Iyer's return comes at a crucial time, just weeks before the T20 World Cup 2026. With the tournament less than a month away, India appear to be lining up Iyer as injury cover for Tilak Varma while also offering the right-hander a timely opportunity to push his case for a World Cup berth.

Day 3 Live Score: Shelton eases through tricky test, Monfils in action Australian Open 2026, Day 3 Live Score: Eighth seed Ben Shelton overcame a tricky test against Ugo Humbert in straight sets to progress to the second round. Madison Keys has stormed her way into Round 2, beating Oleksandra Olinykova at the Rod Laver Arena. Meanwhile, Gael Monfils, playing in the Australian Open for one last time, is taking on a local qualifier.

Saina Nehwal confirms retirement from badminton: Can't push it anymore Former world No.1 Saina Nehwal has confirmed her retirement from badminton, revealing her body can no longer handle the sport's physical demands after two years away from the court.

Kylian Mbappe urges Real Madrid fans to back Vinicius Jr. amid poor formKylian Mbappe has urged the Real Madrid fans to back Vinicius Jr. amidst the Brazilian's poor run of form in recent games. Mbappe said it wasn't good to blame just a player and the whole squad deserves to get stick with their performances.

RCB march into WPL 2026 playoffs with 5th straight win, thrash Gujarat in VadodaraRCB marched into the playoffs of the WPL 2026 season with a comprehensive 61-run win over a hapless Gujarat Giants side, who failed to deliver with the bat in Vadodara on Monday, Janaury 19.

India's top pole-vaulter thrown off train by TTE, viral video sparks controversyNational record holder Dev Meena and fellow athlete Kuldeep Yadav were told to deboard the train at Panvel station. Their mistake? Carry the essential gear of their sport – the pole, while returning from a competition.

Ashwin urges Jadeja to reinvent, find joy like Virat Kohli in twilight phaseFormer India cricketer Ravichandran Ashwin has urged Ravindra Jadeja to reinvent himself in the twilight phase of his career. Ashwin's advice comes after Jadeja struggled to have any impact in the ODI series against New Zealand.

AFCON: Morocco threaten to take legal action against Senegal after final fiascoMorocco Football Federation has threatened legal action against Senegal after Sunday's fiasco in the AFCON final. The game between the two teams saw incredible chaos as Senegal threatened to walk out of the game.

Manchester City sign Marc Guehi from Palace, defender explains reason for moveManchester City has completed the transfer of England international Marc Guehi from Crystal Palace, with the 25-year-old defender joining the Premier League champions on a long-term contract after extensive negotiations.

Gaurav Sawant Reports: ICC Issues Ultimatum to Bangladesh Over World Cup Participation in IndiaOn this Special Report, host Gaurav Sawant examines the escalating tension between the International Cricket Council (ICC) and the Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB). The discussion centers on Bangladesh's hesitation to play World Cup matches in India, citing security concerns following the return of player Mustafizur Rahman. Gaurav Sawant notes, 'So the ICC has read the riot act to Bangladesh,' highlighting the ultimatum that the team must either participate or be replaced by Scotland. The panel, featuring sports editors Vikrant Gupta and Nikhil Naaz, explores whether these concerns are genuine or politically motivated by Bangladesh's interim government. Major Mohammad Ashraful Zaman defends the BCB's stance as a 'genuine concern' rather than politics, while other analysts suggest a potential 'logjam' that could split the cricketing world. The programme delves into the diplomatic friction and the potential long-term impact on bilateral cricket relations between India and Bangladesh.

Australian Open 2026, Day 3 order of play: Defending champions Sinner, Keys in actionDefending champions Jannik Sinner and Madison Keys will be in action as the Australian Open 2026 rolls on to Day 3 on Tuesday, January 20. Naomi Osaka and Ben Shelton will also start their campaigns in Melbourne.

Did Ajinkya Rahane blame Gautam Gambhir for ODI series loss to New Zealand?Former India captain Ajinkya Rahane questioned the Gautam Gambhir-led team management for making frequent changes after the home ODI series loss to New Zealand, stressing the need for clarity and a settled XI ahead of the 2027 ODI World Cup.

Arrested for GOAT tour mismanagement, organiser Satadru gets bail after 37 daysLionel Messi's GOAT tour organiser, Satadru Dutta, was granted bail after 37 days in custody. Dutta was jailed after chaos broke out at the Salt Lake Stadium during Messi's event.

Djokovic begins 25th Grand Slam quest with milestone 100th Australian Open victoryNovak Djokovic kick-started his quest for a record 25th Grand Slam title by registering his 100th career win at the Australian Open. The Serb defeated Spain's Pedro Martinez in straight sets in the opening round in Melbourne.

Steve Smith accepts T20 World Cup fate, targets LA Olympics 2028Australia's Steve Smith might have been snubbed from the T20 World Cup squad, but the 36-year-old is not ready to retire from the format yet. Smith has revealed that he wants to play in the LA Olympics, set to be played in 2028.

Virat Kohli still the fittest, he can play ODIs until he is 45: Simon DoullIndia vs New Zealand: Former New Zealand fast bowler Simon Doull said Virat Kohli has it in him to continue until the age of 45, noting that the India great remains one of the fittest cricketers around. Kohli has scored more than 600 runs in nine matches since returning to action in October 2025.

Pure class: Hon helps injured opponent Stakusic get off court in wheelchairPriscilla Hon showed pure class as she helped her opponent Marina Stakusic leave the court in a wheelchair after getting injured and being forced to retire from their first round clash on Monday, January 19.

Nikhil Naz Slams BCCI Silence After Gautam Gambhir's India Loses Historic ODI Series To New ZealandOn this India Today special report, sports journalist Nikhil Naz analyses the crisis in Indian cricket following a historic ODI series defeat against New Zealand. For the first time since 1988, New Zealand has secured a bilateral ODI series win on Indian soil, also marking India's first ever defeat at Indore's Holkar Stadium. Naz highlights that 'it definitely is a Gambhir situation', pointing to the turbulent tenure of head coach Gautam Gambhir, under whom India has now lost three ODI series. The discussion shifts to the perceived inaction of the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI). Naz criticises the board for failing to hold review meetings or address systemic issues, contrasting their silence with the proactive approach of the English Cricket Board. The report questions whether the management and selectors are being held accountable for the team's declining performance across formats ahead of the 2027 ODI World Cup.

ICC Issues Ultimatum To Bangladesh Over T20 World Cup Participation In IndiaThis report examines the escalating crisis surrounding the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2026 as Bangladesh faces a potential exit from the tournament. The International Cricket Council (ICC) has reportedly issued a firm ultimatum, stating 'you let us know by Wednesday' if a solution can be reached regarding their participation in India. Bangladesh has expressed reluctance to travel to India, requesting a move to neutral venues or a group swap, both of which the ICC has rejected. The programme highlights that Scotland is on standby as a replacement team. Furthermore, the situation has 'snowballed' with reports that Pakistan may also review its participation if Bangladesh is removed. This marks a historic tension where a team faces complete removal rather than just forfeiting points for individual matches, threatening the integrity of the upcoming global event.

Nikhil Naz Discusses Impact Of Delhi's Toxic Air On India's Global Sporting ImageOn this Special Report, Sonal Mehrotra Kapoor and Nikhil Naz discuss the alarming impact of air pollution on India's status as a global sporting hub. The discussion follows reports of Danish shuttler Mia Blichfeldt withdrawing from the India Open and paying a heavy fine to avoid Delhi's toxic air. Indian chess grandmaster Vidit Gujrathi is also quoted, stating that 'People are slowly being poisoned in Delhi and nobody seems to care.' The programme highlights how environmental conditions and poor hygiene at venues are deterring international athletes and affecting the training of budding domestic sportspersons. Nikhil Naz points out that while international players voice concerns, Indian athletes often remain silent due to fear of social media trolling or administrative backlash. The report raises critical questions about India's preparedness for major upcoming events like the World Championships and the Olympics.

Australia to do a Travis Head with Cummins at T20 World Cup? Bailey respondsAustralia's chief selector, George Bailey, has confirmed Pat Cummins will miss the T20 World Cup opener, while Tim David is expected to be fit despite a minor injury setback. Updates on Josh Hazlewood and squad selection deadlines were also provided.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
